fields.description:
Tool definition consists of a function main. Return value of this main function is passed to the LLM.

Tool definition guidelines
  • Tool definition should have a valid Python function named main.
  • Use from module import item instead of import module.
  • Not all imports are allowed, test the function to find out if the import works.
  • Use simple type annotations to infer JSON schema type for the arguments.
  • Complex types like str | int cannot be inferred from.
fields.label: Code

fields.description: Used to generate tool schema. This is required by the LLM to understand the tool.
fields.label: Description

fields.description:
Tool description should consist the following information:
  • What function does tool perform
  • How to interpret the return value if if required
fields.label: Description

fields.description:
Arg descriptions should tell then LLM what the argument is for. If needed it should also describe its structure (if a nested data type is used).

If the main function in Code is has type annotations, this list can be auto generated. If the type annotations are complex, the type will be set as unknown this should be overridden with a valid JSON type. Ref: JSON Schema Types
fields.label: Args

fields.description: Snake cased name of the tool. This is the name that the LLM sees.
fields.label: Slug

fields.description: If tool is invalid and is included in a task, task session will fail.
fields.label: Is Valid

fields.description: Reason for why tool is invalid.
fields.label: Reason

fields.description: If enabled, the args provided by the LLM are logged in Otto Scrapbook. The main function is not actually called.
fields.label: Mock Tool

fields.description: Return value to give the LLM when the tool is mocked. Should be a JSON loadable string.
fields.label: Mock Return Value

Tool requires permission to execute.

If checked an Otto Permission entry will be created during task execution when this tool is called by the LLM.
